page.title: 17Issues Of 1985
page.content: We collected data from the survey we sent round. We found that the main issue of 1985 was unemployment.96 out of 200 people thought it was the most important issue.39 people thought that{violence was a major issue as well as {unemployment. 26 people thought that{famine}was the most important issue.Closely followed by{nuclear weapons}and{world {peace}with 22 people in favour of them. There were some issues which only a few people chose like{Mrs Thatcher,the {Merchant Navy,politics}and the{miner's {strike.
